A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: In a movie that sets up failure for practically every character (except Rey which is a small flaw) it is incredibly interesting that this movie is also “failing” in the box office (which is laughable) and a “failure” with its audience. I love that the audience still can’t recognize that this movie is all about failure. We are not supposed to like what happened in this movie. Just like in Empire\, we weren’t supposed to like what happened with Luke and Vader\, or Han Solo getting frozen in carbonite. And OBVIOUSLY questions are left unanswered. There is another 2 hour movie coming that needs to have some intrigue.
